unionLists.pl

00001 ######################################################################
00002 ##
00003 ##  Functions used to make <UL> and <OL> lists in HTML files
00004 ##  and corresponding lists in TeX mode.
00005 ##
00006 ##    BeginList()             starts a list
00007 ##    $ITEM                   start a list item
00008 ##    $ITEMSEP                puts spacing between items
00009 ##    EndList()               ends a list
00010 ##
00011 ##    BeginParList()          starts a list of paragraphs
00012 ##    EndParList()            ends such a list
00013 ##
00014 
00015 sub _unionLists_init {}; # don't reload this file
00016 
00017 =head2 unionLists.pl
00018 
00019  ######################################################################
00020  #
00021  #  Usage:  BeginList(type,options);
00022  #
00023  #  Produces <OL> and <UL> lists.  Type must be either "OL" or "UL",
00024  #  (and defaults to "OL").  The options are
00025  #
00026  #    type => "type"            Specifies the type of marker
00027  #                              (default is none specified)
00028  #
00029  #    value => num or string    Specified the initial value of the
00030  #                              item numbering
00031  #
00032  #    tex_par => 1 or 0         Set paragraph spacing in TeX mode
00033  #                              (default is 0)
00034  #
00035  #    noTopSkip => 1 or 0       Remove top skip produced by enumerate
00036  #                              in TeX mode
00037  #                              (default is 0)
00038  #
00039  #  Example:
00040  #
00041  #    BEGIN_TEXT
00042  #      \{BeginList("OL")\}
00043  #      $ITEM This is the first item
00044  #      $ITEM This is the second
00045  #      \{EndList("OL")\}
00046  #    END_TEXT
00047  #
00048  #
00049  #  Usage:  EndList(type)
00050  #
00051  #  where type is the list type (and must match the BeginList type).
00052  #
00053  
00054  
00055  
00056 =cut
00057 
00058 our $bHTML = '\begin{rawhtml}';
00059 our $eHTML = '\end{rawhtml}';
00060 
00061 sub BeginList {
00062   my $LIST = 'OL';
00063   $LIST = shift if (uc($_[0]) eq "OL" or uc($_[0]) eq "UL");
00064   my $enum = ($LIST eq 'OL' ? "enumerate" : "itemize");
00065   my %options = @_;
00066   $LIST .= ' TYPE="'.$options{type}.'"' if defined($options{type});
00067   $LIST .= ' START="'.$options{value}.'"' if defined($options{value});
00068   $LIST = "<$LIST>";
00069   my $tex = ""; my $type = ""; my $top = "";
00070   $tex .= "\\parindent=0pt \\parskip=.75\\baselineskip\n" if $options{tex_par};
00071   $tex .= "\\setcounter{enumi}{".($options{value}-1)."}" if defined($options{value}) && $LIST eq 'OL';
00072   $type = "[\\quad $options{type}.]" if defined($options{type}) && $LIST eq 'OL';
00073   $top = '\vskip-\parskip\hrule height 0pt' if $options{noTopSkip};
00074 
00075   MODES(
00076     TeX => "\\par${top}{\\parskip=0pt\\begin{$enum}$type\n$tex",
00077     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.$LIST.$eHTML,
00078     HTML => $LIST."\n"
00079   );
00080 }
00081 
00082 #
00083 #  Usage:  EndList(type)
00084 #
00085 #  where type is the list type (and must match the BeginList type).
00086 #
00087 sub EndList {
00088   my $LIST = shift; $LIST = 'OL' unless defined $LIST;
00089   my $enum = ($LIST eq 'OL' ? "enumerate" : "itemize");
00090   $LIST = "</$LIST>";
00091   MODES(
00092     TeX => "\\end{$enum}}",
00093     Latex2HTML => $bHTML.$LIST.$eHTML,
00094     HTML => $LIST."\n"
00095   );
00096 }
00097 
00098 #
00099 #  Syntactic sugar for making lists of paragraphs
00100 #
00101 sub BeginParList {
00102   my $LIST = 'OL';
00103   $LIST = shift if (uc($_[0]) eq "OL" or uc($_[0]) eq "UL");
00104   BeginList($LIST,tex_par=>1,@_);
00105 }
00106 
00107 sub EndParList {EndList(@_)};
00108 
00109 
00110 #
00111 #  Use $ITEM to introduce a new list item
00112 #
00113 $ITEM = MODES(
00114   TeX => '\item\ignorespaces ',
00115   Latex2HTML => $bHTML.'<LI>'.$eHTML,
00116   HTML => "<LI>"
00117 );
00118 
00119 #
00120 #  This is a hack for when you want MSIE to handle
00121 #  space between list items properly
00122 #
00123 $ITEMSEP = MODES(
00124   TeX => '\par\vskip-\parskip\vskip\baselineskip ',
00125   Latex2HTML => $bHTML."<BR><BR>".$eHTML,
00126   HTML => "<BR><BR>"
00127 );
00128 
00129 1;
